comments.content:
Second, third and fourth samples are different weights of [Futura.](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/futura/)   
   
Second sample looks like Futura Heavy   
THird sample looks like Futura Medium   
Fourth sample looks like Futura Light

Will,   
   
The first links didn't work for me. (Remote Linking Forbidden, or some such message), but your last link shows Futura.

[ITC Stone Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-stone-serif-2/itc-stone-serif/testdrive.html?s=You+want+some+real+future-car+porn%3F&p=24).   
   
 [Futura Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/futura/heavy/testdrive.html?s=By+midcentury%2C+we+will+have+merged&p=24).   
   
 [Futura Medium Oblique](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/futura/medium-oblique/testdrive.html?s=Watch+out+for+that+car%21+Red+liiiiiight%21%21%21&p=24).   
   
 [Futura Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516225216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/futura/light/testdrive.html?s=In+his+essay+on+the+future+of+the+automobile&p=24).   
   
For the Futuras, the Linotype version is a better match than the Bitstream (look at the difference in bowl widths in the B).

oh... and the type on the REMOTE LINKING FORBIDDEN ...   
looks like Arial   
   
;)
